name: A Theory of Human (De)Motivation
description:
In 1943, Abraham Maslow focuses on the developments of human fondamental needs in his essay "A Theory of Human Motivation". He sorts the different fondamental needs in a pyramid, creating the famous Maslow's pyramid. The experience of "A Theory of Human (De)Motivation" is based on this theory.

You are J, a student who just found out he failed college in his last semester, but he will soon find out that that's the least of his worries... Follow him as he attempts to leave his building on what will definitely be the worst day of his life. Will he survive his journey? Or will he descend into madness, lacking even the most basic human needs?
